body_html: Yes, int32 is special in that all GPU kernels are actually CPU kernels. The reason behind it is that it is mostly used for shape arithmetic. The recommended workaround is to use either UINT32 or INT64.
body_text: Yes, int32 is special in that all GPU kernels are actually CPU kernels. The reason behind it is that it is mostly used for shape arithmetic. The recommended workaround is to use either UINT32 or INT64.
body: Yes, int32 is special in that all GPU kernels are actually CPU kernels. The reason behind it is that it is mostly used for shape arithmetic. The recommended workaround is to use either UINT32 or INT64.
